Jaques Offenbach - Les Contes d'Hoffman
Composer: Jacques Offenbach
Libretto: Jules Barbier

The opera was first performed, without the 'Giulietta' act, at the OpÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©ra-Comique on 10 February 1881. It had been played through in a complete form at the house of Offenbach, 8 Boulevard des Capucines, on 18 May 1879, with Madame Franck-Duvernoy in the soprano roles, Auguez as Hoffmann and ÃƒÆ’Ã¢â‚¬Â°mile-Alexandre
Taskin in the four villain roles, with Edmond Duvernoy at the piano and chorus directed by Albert Vizentini. The director of the Ringtheater in Vienna, Franz von Jauner was also present, and a four-act version was later staged there on 8 December 1881.

This is a version with 5 acts.
Act I
Act II Olympia
Act III Antonia
Act IV Giulietta (here you'll find the famous Barcarolle. The first 2 tracks on disc 3).
Act V Stella


Released 01/02/1996 
Cat Number 0630-14330-2 (3CD) 
Label Erato 
Barcode 0706301433027
